http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/descript.@value: Ontology to capture concepts related to location. Reuses the wgs ontology.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value:
Developed as part of the overall iCity ontology effort, the iCity-wgs ontology is designed to capture concepts related to the geo location.
		Copyright @ 2016 Megan Katsumi, iCity Research Group

http://www.w3.org/ns/adms#relatedDocumen.@value: Under development. Please see report on iCity Ontology v1.

http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/descript.@value: Annotation property added for organizational purposes, to identify annotation properties defined in the wgs Ontology.
Property added for organizational purposes, to identify properties defined in the wgs Ontology.
Class added for organizational purposes, to identify classes defined in the wgs Ontology.

A vocabulary for representing latitude, longitude and 
 altitude information in the WGS84 geodetic reference datum. 
 Version $Id: wgs84_pos.rdf,v 1.22 2009/04/20 15:00:30 timbl Exp $. See http://www.w3.org/2003/01/geo/ for more details.

revision 1.5
date: 2003/01/10 20:14:31;  author: danbri;  state: Exp;  lines: +16 -5
Updated schema:
Added a dc:date, added url for more info. Changed the rdfs:label of the
namespace from gp to geo. Added a class Point, set as the rdfs:domain of
each property. Added XML comment on the lat_long property suggesting that
we might not need it (based on #rdfig commentary from implementors).

revision 1.1
date: 2003/01/10 10:53:23;  author: danbri;  state: Exp;
basic geo vocab

Uniquely identified by lat/long/alt. i.e.

spaciallyIntersects(P1, P2) :- lat(P1, LAT), long(P1, LONG), alt(P1, ALT),
  lat(P2, LAT), long(P2, LONG), alt(P2, ALT).

sameThing(P1, P2) :- type(P1, Point), type(P2, Point), spaciallyIntersects(P1, P2).
A point, typically described using a coordinate system relative to Earth, such as WGS84.

Anything with spatial extent, i.e. size, shape, or position.
 e.g. people, places, bowling balls, as well as abstract areas like cubes.

The WGS84 altitude of a SpatialThing (decimal meters 
above the local reference ellipsoid).
The WGS84 latitude of a SpatialThing (decimal degrees).
A comma-separated representation of a latitude, longitude coordinate.

The relation between something and the point, 
 or other geometrical thing in space, where it is.  For example, the realtionship between
 a radio tower and a Point with a given lat and long.
 Or a relationship between a park and its outline as a closed arc of points, or a road and
 its location as a arc (a sequence of points).
 Clearly in practice there will be limit to the accuracy of any such statement, but one would expect
 an accuracy appropriate for the size of the object and uses such as mapping .
The WGS84 longitude of a SpatialThing (decimal degrees).
